definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: This type of money is hard to come by and can be very fickle in its affections.
sentences.chinese: 這種錢是來之不易的，並因爲情感而非常易變。

sentences.english: Reducing variability frequently incurs a drop in latency and throughput performance.
sentences.chinese: 減少易變性通常會增加延遲時間和降低吞吐量性能。

sentences.english: Woman is always fickle and changeable.
Don't underestimate the changeability of the weather here.
sentences.chinese: 不要低估了這裏天氣的易變性。

sentences.english: Since he is a man of two minds, unstable in all his ways.
sentences.chinese: 三心兩意的人，在他一切的行徑上，易變無定。

sentences.english: Indeed, the law of volatility can be invoked again.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，易變性法則又起作用了。

sentences.english: As a treatment provider, I've tried to be open to the changeability of my clients.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個醫生，我已試圖對我客戶的易變敞開心扉。

sentences.english: Some design problems are easier to solve with mutable objects.
sentences.chinese: 有一些設計問題還是使用易變對象比較容易解決。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, unpredictable weather has also caused recent volatility in prices.
sentences.chinese: 同時，易變的天氣也造成最近價格的波動。

sentences.english: Constancy is therefore inconstancy held in check and confined to the same object.
sentences.chinese: 就是將易變控制與侷限在同一個對象上。

sentences.english: The fluky stock market makes shareholders nervous.
sentences.chinese: 易變的股票市場使持股票者緊張不安。

sentences.english: Its control parameters are easy to change, and are very unsteady .
sentences.chinese: 它的控制參數易變，非常不穩定。

sentences.english: More often than not, they involve mutable object state.
sentences.chinese: 而它們時常也會涉及易變的對象狀態。

sentences.english: In general, it is a recommended practice to assess volatility and volume with the same basis.
sentences.chinese: 通常，推薦在同樣的基礎上評估易變率和容積。

sentences.english: Cannot create a stable subkey under a volatile parent key.
sentences.chinese: 無法在易變父項下創建穩定子項。

sentences.english: A good thing, though, is that oily skin is not prone much to aging and wrinkling.
sentences.chinese: 不過好的一面是油性皮膚不容易變衰老長皺紋。

definition: each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
